newsitem.title: USA: Mesa names new chief; replaces retiring Boone Pickens.
newsitem.headline: Mesa names new chief; replaces retiring Boone Pickens.

text.p: Mesa Inc. said Thursday its board elected Jon Brumley chairman and chief executive, succeeding company founder Boone Pickens, who is retiring from the oil and natural gas company.
Brumley was most recently chairman and CEO of Cross Timbers Oil Co., which he co-founded.
Pickens, once a renowned corporate raider, said in June that he would retire once a successor was hired.
He will remain on the board of Mesa, which he founded 40 years ago.
Mesa's stock was up 62.5 cents at $3.875 and Cross Timbers rose 25 cents at $22.75 on the New York Stock Exchange.
